alert.note: Alert for Smith; Upshur; Wood (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 12:27PM CDT until May 05 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Smith, Upshur and Wood. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 and a half inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tyler, Gilmer, Mineola, Lindale, Big Sandy, Hawkins, Hoard, Rosewood, Winona, Midway, Red Springs, Pritchett, Grice, Carroll and Bettie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
